Inline Nitrogen

With Inline Nitrogen, you can now place a Nitrogen module directly on another web page, even a static .html page.

For example:

Inline Nitrogen uses dynamic script tags to issue postbacks to your Nitrogen server. (In keeping with the cleaning supply nomenclature, we call this technology "Windex".)

For Windex to work, you must be able to add <script> tags to the hosting page.

Potential Uses:

  • Make a hosted comment system (like Disqus or Intense Debate) that doesn't use IFrames.
  • Add Erlang-based features to your existing Ruby/Java/C# web app.
  • Post a usable Nitrogen application to your blog.

View source to see how it's done!
